landingContent.heroTagline: Know Your Audience Inside and Out
landingContent.heroSubtitle: Generate detailed personas that reveal your ideal clients' pain points, desires, and the exact language that moves them to action.
tips: Be specific - 'busy executives' is too vague; 'VP of Sales at B2B SaaS companies' is actionable
Include emotional drivers - what keeps them up at night? What would make them feel successful?
Map the journey - understand where they are now and where they want to be
Use their language - capture the exact words they use to describe their challenges

examples.title: Overwhelmed Entrepreneur

examples.title: Ambitious Sales Leader

faq.question: How detailed should my input be?
faq.answer: The more specific, the better. Include industry, role level, company size, and any demographic details you know.

faq.question: How many personas do I need?
faq.answer: Start with your primary audience (80% of clients). Add 1-2 secondary personas if you serve distinct segments.

faq.question: How do I use personas in my marketing?
faq.answer: Reference your persona when writing copy, creating content, or planning campaigns. Ask 'Would this resonate with [persona name]?'

faq.question: How often should I update personas?
faq.answer: Review quarterly and update when you notice shifts in who's buying or what they care about.
